basics.name: Yutong Feng (Thea Feng)
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: A Master of Computer Science student at Rice University with extensive programming and development experience.

work.name: Alibaba Group
work.summary: Worked on UNet, a Chromium-based network stack, and implemented features to improve performance and extensibility.
highlights: Designed a network diagnostic tool achieving high accuracy across devices.
Implemented an interface for the Apollo Player to use UNet for network requests.
Increased TCP connection success rate with a smart IP address selection mechanism.

work.name: Tuyoo Games
work.summary: Optimized database schema and automated server processes for better performance.
highlights: Performed schema optimization of a Redis database.
Developed a game server management tool enabling live updates.
Built a proxy login tool to transfer user data between different production environments.

work.name: AIRS Lab
work.summary: Developed an optimized compiler for the Oat programming language.
highlights: Led the FedCampus project team and created an Android demo to analyze user data with advanced privacy-preserving techniques.
Implemented incentive mechanisms for federated learning, securing a patent and publications in IEEE ICDCS and IEEE TMC.

work.name: Apartsa
work.summary: Developed a front-end application and improved API performance.
highlights: Built a scalable Wechat app for over 2000 users.
Optimized routing API to reduce page-switching time by 32%.

education.institution: The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen

projects.name: Rookie DB
projects.description: A lightweight relational database management system in Java.
highlights: Implemented a buffer pool manager to improve query latency by 20%.
Developed write-ahead logging (WAL) to ensure crash recovery with 0.001% failure rate.
Enhanced concurrency with a multi-granularity locking protocol.

projects.name: CUDA-Optimized File System
projects.description: A GPU-accelerated Linux-like file system supporting high-volume data processing.
highlights: Reduced page table memory footprint by 50%.
Improved page swap efficiency by 95% using optimized structures.
